statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeeAttrition;
SELECT employee_id, job_satisfaction FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT salary, job_satisfaction FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE job_satisfaction > 3.5;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAttrition ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT employee_id, salary FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE job_satisfaction < 2.0;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE job_satisfaction > 3.5 ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT employee_id, salary FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE salary BETWEEN 50000 AND 80000;
SELECT employee_id, job_satisfaction, salary FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE job_satisfaction < 3 ORDER BY job_satisfaction ASC, salary DESC;
SELECT employee_id, job_satisfaction FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE salary < 60000 AND job_satisfaction > 1;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAttrition WHERE salary > 70000 ORDER BY job_satisfaction DESC, salary ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, job_title FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT department, job_satisfaction FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT employee_name, department, salary FROM employees WHERE job_satisfaction < 0.6;
SELECT employee_id, job_performance_rating, performance_review FROM job_performance ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, job_title, salary FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT employee_name, job_title, department, job_satisfaction FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY job_satisfaction DESC;
SELECT performance_id, employee_id, job_performance_rating FROM job_performance JOIN employees ON job_performance.employee_id = employees.employee_id WHERE job_performance_rating > 4;

SELECT attrition_id, employees.employee_name, attrition_rate, reason FROM attrition_rates JOIN employees ON attrition_rates.employee_id = employees.employee_id WHERE attrition_rate > 0.2 ORDER BY attrition_rate ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000
SELECT employee_name, job_satisfaction, salary FROM employees WHERE job_satisfaction >= 4.5
SELECT * FROM departments ORDER BY department_name
SELECT department_name, department_head FROM departments
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY employee_name DESC
SELECT employee_name, job_satisfaction FROM employees WHERE job_satisfaction < 3.5
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.department_id
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.department_id GROUP BY department_name
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.department_id
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, job_title FROM employees;
SELECT job_satisfaction, salary FROM employees ORDER BY job_satisfaction DESC;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, job_title, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT employee_name, job_title FROM employees WHERE job_satisfaction < 0.5;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, job_title FROM employees ORDER BY job_title ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT employee_name, job_title, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT employee_name, job_satisfaction FROM employees WHERE job_satisfaction < 0.5 ORDER BY job_satisfaction ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name FROM employees e JOIN employees_department ed ON e.employee_id = ed.employee_id JOIN departments d ON ed.department_id = d.department_id LIMIT 5;
SELECT e.employee_name, ar.attrition_rate, ar.year FROM employees e JOIN attrition_rates ar ON e.employee_id = ar.employee_id ORDER BY ar.attrition_rate DESC, ar.year ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_name, job_title, salary FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_name, job_title, salary FROM Employee ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT department_name, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM Employee JOIN Department ON Employee.employee_id = Department.manager_id GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT employee_name, review_date, performance_rating FROM Employee JOIN PerformanceReview ON Employee.employee_id = PerformanceReview.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE job_satisfaction > 3 ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT employee_name, job_title, hire_date FROM Employee WHERE salary > 50000 AND job_satisfaction = 4
SELECT department_name, location FROM Department WHERE manager_id IS NOT NULL ORDER BY department_id
SELECT employee_name, job_title, hire_date FROM Employee WHERE job_satisfaction < 3 AND salary < 40000
SELECT employee_name, job_title, hire_date, performance_rating FROM Employee e JOIN PerformanceReview pr ON e.employee_id = pr.employee_id WHERE pr.performance_rating > 3
